intro: Neonauclea ventricosa, commonly known as the African milkwood tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers followed by oval, woody fruits containing several seeds. It is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Neonauclea ventricosa is also valued for its timber and traditional medicinal uses.
